metadata.synopsis:
Three ogres are eating remains and arguing about what the remains taste like..Then they spy the player, who needs to prove themselves to keep from being eaten.

Two of them are stupid, like most ogres. One of them, Lump, is very smart after accidentally eating a headband of intellect. His voice should be deep, and he should sounds lascivious in the way he speaks of food.

47.speaker: Chock
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ogres eating a corpse and remark on what it tastes like, custom scene viewer

54.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
54.text: Gentlemen - contain yourselves. This quarrel sours our feast. Besides - taste like pork!

37.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
37.text: Brothers, look here. I have eyed yet another prize. Fortune favours our bellies!

42.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
42.text: Stranger: be you friend or food? The mark is Her measure: show us the brand of the Absolute.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: You're quite eloquent for an ogre.

100.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
100.text: Am I not astonishing? A robust diet makes for a shrewd mind, you see. I am a gourmand...

30.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
30.text: ... and you, a delicacy - were I so lucky.

118.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
118.text: ... and you, a delicacy - unless you bear the mark, of course.

19.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Lump grins a creepy, hungry grin.|NodeContext: A creepy hungry growl. After he kills the player, he plans to eat them.

130.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
130.text: I see it. How regrettable, that your meat must go unsavoured.

14.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
14.context: NodeContext: Should suddenly sound all ogre-ish and stupid. He's talking to his stupid brothers.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: You are quite the articulate ogre.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: I notice you don't bear a brand of your own.

2.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
2.text: I've no use for the Absolute - or any god. I follow two masters only: gluttony and greed.

25.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
25.text: The goblins understand my appetites. They sate my hunger for gold...

142.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
142.text: ... and the rest sate my hunger for meat.

132.speaker: Chock
132.text: Boss goblin give gold. We check brand. Good deal!

3.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Lump bonks Chock on the head. Chock rubs his head in response.|

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Forget goblins. You should be fighting for me.

11.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
11.text: I am by all accounts a student of higher commerce and extortion.

34.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
34.text: Make me an offer. Tempt me.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I'll give you [6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54] gold if I can call you into battle.

57.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
57.text: A serenade to my ears, and a boon to my belly. We've a bargain, my tasty kibble!

9.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
9.text: Take my bonehorn. One blow, and the ground will quake with my family name.

58.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
58.text: Use it when the need arises - and never a moment before.

24.speaker: Chock
24.text: Ogre kill everyone around! Then ogre eats them!

60.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
60.text: Well spoken. Indeed, ogre 'kill everyone around'.
60.context: NodeContext: Last bit he is echoing what the dumb ogre just said.

43.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
43.text: We will keep close. When you are ready, sound the horn.

140.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
140.text: Take my bonehorn. One blow, and... just a moment. It's been thieved - and I know the culprit.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: I'll give you [463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca] gold - after you fight for me.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: How about I spare your life. That tempting enough?

65.speaker: Player
65.text: JOIN ME OR I'LL CRUSH YOU TO PULP!

6.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
6.text: Come, now. Famished though we are, we're friends - are we not?

119.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
119.text: Such sweet suggestions. Have a care - you may make yourself stringy.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: [463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca] - to be paid once the killing's done.

143.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
143.text: A twice-played serenade to my ears, my tasty kibble. We have a bargain!

131.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
131.text: Come, now. An ogre feasts not on promises.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: [463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca] gold - after you fight for me.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I'll pay you in the flesh of the fallen - you'll have your fill.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I'll pay you in the flesh of the fallen - you'll have your fill.

70.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
70.text: A brilliant notion, and a boon to my aching belly. We have a deal, my tasty kibble!

32.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
32.text: A slip of the tongue - you meant to make a better offer, surely.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Fight for me and my oath or I'll cut the last meal from your belly.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I've changed my mind. The offer is off the table.

62.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
62.text: Oh, but you do love to tease.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I've seen few other ogres in these parts.

150.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
150.text: Mm - your candour makes you all the more enticing.

86.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
86.text: We follow the scents of blood and gold to all lands fertile, friend.

120.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
120.text: And this land proves particularly... fruitful.

59.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
59.text: Alas - not so much as a nibble.

105.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
105.context: NodeContext: Sigh at the beginning of the line. He is a tiny bit exasperated and sad

110.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
110.text: How regrettable. Tell me, sweet creature: does your flesh taste as honeyed as I could hope for?

90.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
90.text: Unh. You wound me, creature. I can hardly resist you.
90.context: NodeContext: Absolutely stricken by this creature he would LOVE to eat

88.speaker: Player
88.text: I'll leave that to your imagination.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I'll do you one better - I'm one of the Absolute's chosen disciples.

46.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
46.text: Indeed? How regrettable, that your meat must go unsavoured.

87.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
87.text: How regrettable. Tell me, sweet creature: does your flesh taste as honeyed as I could hope for?

15.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
15.text: I expect more than your word. Show me your flesh.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: What about you? I'm feeling hungry...

5.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
5.text: No one is food today, alas. It seems we are friends.

94.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
94.text: An admirable instinct, but you're biting off more than you can chew.

64.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
64.text: No, not food. Too tough for your digestion, I fear. Perhaps... friend, then?

123.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
123.text: Such an uncouth outburst - I fear it may spoil the succulence of your meat.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: Try to eat me and I'll brand your corpse with the mark of my oath.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Flash your arm at him. There you are. You could see the brand, could you not?

89.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
89.text: Yes, yes - the mark is unmistakable. How regrettable, that your meat must go unsavoured.

49.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
49.text: Yes, yes - the mark is unmistakable. Tell me, sweet creature: does your flesh taste as honeyed as I could hope for?

27.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
27.text: Ha! Did you expect The Enlightened to fall for such a crude ruse?

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Do not test the Absolute's finest, ogre. You would not survive Her wrath.

68.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
68.text: Spoken with the confidence only a True Soul could muster!

13.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
13.text: How regrettable, that your meat must go unsavoured.

8.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
8.text: Tell me, sweet creature: does your flesh taste as honeyed as I could hope for?

35.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
35.text: She scampered in from the east, calling for 'Yul'. A pet, no doubt.
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom cam on gutted tiefling

28.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
28.text: The green earth bless us, she bore no mark. Those horns - mm, mm. Such cartilaginous crunch!

133.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
133.text: Now let's see that mark, lest I give in to my cravings.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: These horns are not yours to take! Attack.

55.speaker: Chock
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ogres eating a corpse and remark on what it tastes like, custom scene viewer

97.speaker: Chock
97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ogres eating a corpse and remark on what it tastes like, custom scene viewer

108.speaker: Chock
108.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ogres eating a corpse and remark on what it tastes like, custom scene viewer

128.speaker: Chock
128.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ogres eating a corpse and remark on what it tastes like, custom scene viewer
